statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Alabama 84, Troy 72
article.story: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) -- Richard Hendrix scored 22 points and pulled down 23 rebounds to lead Alabama to a 84-72 victory over Troy in the season opener for both schools. Hendrix lost 25 pounds during the off season and showed off his slimmed down body as he scored eight of Alabama's first 10 points and dominated the boards. Many of Hendrix points came on powerful dunks from under the basket. The score was tied 36-36 at halftime, but Alabama (1-0) outscored the Trojans (0-1) 20-9 in the first four minutes of the second half. But the Trojans came back and took a 65-64 lead at 12:17 in the game on a layup by Michael Vogler. The more physical Crimson Tide took control from there and outscored the Trojans 17-2 over the next 10 minutes to take an 81-67 lead with 2:12 to play. Demetrius Jemison also scored a double-double for Alabama, getting 15 points and 10 rebounds. Justin Tubbs added 13 points for Alabama, while Mykail Riley had 11. It was the first game for freshman Rico Pickett, starting in place of star point guard Ronald Steele, who is taking a redshirt year after having surgery on both knees. Leading scorer for the Trojans was O'Darien Bassett with 17 points, while Justin Jonas had 15 and Tracey Macon 13. Jonas is a former Alabama player, who tranferred to Troy.
